title.narrative: ILC-Chile: Medicamentos para Venezuela, II - Medicine for Venezuela, II

description.narrative: This project (Phase II) continues to support the Lutheran Church of Chile (ILC-Chile) in responding to the horrific shortages in Venezuela, focusing on providing basic medications for distribution to 400 beneficiaries utilizing a network of 24 congregations that form part of the Lutheran Church of Venezuela (ILV). The project functions in the following manner: 1) A list of the most common medicines available for purchase in Chile, not requiring a medical prescription, is elaborated and sent to the ILV distribution centers (congregations). 2) Church and community member beneficiaries identify up to a maximum of 3 needed medications. 3) The requisitions are sent to ILC-Chile, where the medicines are purchased with the assistance of a collaborating network of doctors and pharmacies. 4) The solicited medicines are sent via courier to each ILV distribution center (congregation) and delivered to the indicated beneficiaries. This process will be repeated twice between December, 2017 and September, 2018 and will be implemented by the ILC-Chile with funding from LWR with support from LCMS.
